poem:
The Audience Awakes  

in the dim light  
flickers and fumes,  
a gasp uproarious  
echoes—a world  
paused, eyes entrained.  
gen Z, entranced,  
beyond pixels, live,  
breath meeting breath,  
in a shared pulse of  
fleeting now,  
they watch, they see—  
history's most famous  
moment in air  
and laughter catching  
the morning after.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How The Celebrity Traitors reversed TV’s most troubling trend default There are not many plaudits left for The Celebrity Traitors, which has delivered tension, crowd-pleasing ineptitude and the most famous fart in television history. Yet for all the show’s achievements, one in particular – a feat that TV executives across the globe have been desperate to deliver – may stand out as the most impressive: it has got gen Z watching live TV. There has". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
